common_issues.title: Pieces connectivity and functionality issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces failing to connect remotely, especially within Docker containers. This is due to Pieces defaulting to the loopback interface. Solutions include upgrading to version 2.0.2, setting a blank custom URL, or using the workaround with DNS entries. Other issues involve OpenAI API key issues and Neural Code Search failing to return results, with ongoing investigations and workarounds suggested.

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key points raised:** * Malanciault reported an issue where Pieces wasn't connecting remotely from their dev container. * Pieces support bot triaged the issue and suggested potential solutions. * Malanciault provided more information about the problem, including screenshots. **Problems identified:** * The default listening interface of the Pieces server was changed to loopback, causing connectivity issues with remote instances. * Docker's host.docker.internal resolution wasn't working with Pieces' Webview tool windows. **Solutions proposed/implemented:** * Malanciault suggested a complex workaround involving dns name entries. * Robert, from the Pieces team, proposed a patch allowing the server to listen on all interfaces. * A simpler workaround was suggested, involving setting a blank custom URL and waiting for the patch release. * The patch was implemented and released as version 2.0.1 of the Pieces for VSCode extension. **Current status/outcome:** * The issue has been resolved in version 2.0.2 of the Pieces for VSCode extension. **Additional notes:** * Malanciault confirmed the issue was fixed after updating to version 2.0.2. * A video call was scheduled to address remaining concerns before the final resolution was identified and implemented.

related_issues.title: Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
related_issues.text:
Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

hi i have been using it for 2 days but for the last 2 hours the desktop and visual studio extension are not working. 

No matter what I type, it gives me this error. There was an update message for the app, it was about installing a version, I installed it but it didn't fix it.
always the same message 
visual studio ide 2022 17.12 
windows 10 pro
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c64d85bd-eb1a-4f1c-a25e-570c9a55ccd1)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55b600a6-95f4-4e71-aee1-1b1ce8b6599c)


## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users are experiencing issues with the Pieces service.
* The issues seem to be related to the OpenAI API key and the Claude and Gemini language models.

**Problems Identified:**

* OpenAI API keys may become invalid over time.
* Claude and Gemini language models have been experiencing issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Remove the OpenAI API key.
* Switch to the GPT4o language model.
* Ensure Pieces is updated to version 11.0.3.
* Sign in to Pieces to increase rate limit.
* Switch to an OpenAI model if issues persist.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Removing the OpenAI API key has resolved the issue for some users.
* The root cause of the issues with Claude and Gemini is still being investigated.
* Users are advised to keep their OpenAI API key out of the product for now.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was originally reported on December 28, 2024.
* The latest update was on January 14, 2025.
* The issue is still open and being investigated.

related_issues.title: Neural Code Search returns no results

Neural Code Search returns no results
### Software

Desktop Application

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have four materials entered since a few days ago and NCS type search never returns anything.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cea82b95-b382-45f3-8777-227d3abd2269)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/175e6117-9ef6-49c0-94f2-26812b788080)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @hovek created an issue with details unknown.

**Problems Identified:**

* Issue details not provided.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces support bot triaged and routed the issue to the appropriate team member.
* Offered helpful resources: 
    * Existing Issues list 
    * Documentation 
    * YouTube Channel

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue is being reviewed by the Pieces team. 
* User is advised to expect a follow-up within 24 hours.

common_issues.title: Pieces connection issues across platforms
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces connection errors in web, desktop, and VS Code extensions. Problems include API key issues, remote connection failures, and general service outages. Solutions involve updating Pieces, checking API keys, configuring remote connections, and waiting for service restoration or bug fixes.

related_issues.title: Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED     http://127.0.0.1:1000/.well-known/health
related_issues.text:
Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED     http://127.0.0.1:1000/.well-known/health
### Software

Web Extension

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Chrome browser slows to a crawl while hundreds of these errors are issued:
Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED     http://127.0.0.1:1000/.well-known/health   

Disabling the extension stops it, re-enabling invokes it again
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* This issue was automatically triaged as a duplicate of a similar issue related to Chrome Extension errors.
* The user, @SteveW555, reported issues with developer console errors when using the Chrome Extension.
* This issue was addressed as a duplicate of a previously reported issue.


**Problems Identified:**

* Developer console errors in Chrome Extension.


**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* This issue will be fixed in the upcoming release of the extension. The anticipated release date is within the next day or two.


**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue closed as a duplicate and likely fixed in the upcoming Chrome extension update.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Performance and API Issues
common_issues.description: Users report high RAM/CPU usage with PiecesOS, potentially due to internet connectivity or background processes.  Short-term solutions include restarting PiecesOS or limiting large file interactions.  Additionally, users experience unresponsive behavior or errors, likely linked to OpenAI API, Claude, or Gemini issues.  Suggested fixes include removing API keys, switching to GPT4o, or ensuring the latest PiecesOS version.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* High memory and CPU usage of PiecesOS, affecting user experience.
* Memory usage sometimes exceeding 3GB, even when no models are installed or running.
* CPU usage spikes up to 120%, causing system slowdown.
* Memory usage seems to increase after optimizing it.
* Some users suspect PiecesOS is mining cryptocurrency.

**Problems Identified:**

* Memory leak causing high RAM usage.
* High CPU usage even for simple tasks.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Optimize memory usage button to unload unused ML models.
* Ability to turn off Live Context feature to reduce memory usage.
* Ongoing work to improve performance and reduce resource consumption.
* Scheduling calls with users experiencing high resource usage.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* PiecesOS team acknowledges the issue and is working on improvements.
* Memory usage around 2GB is considered normal, but exceeding that indicates a potential problem.
* Users are encouraged to report excessive resource usage for further investigation.
* Some users are uninstalling PiecesOS due to resource concerns.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation spans from April 2024 to January 2025, indicating an ongoing issue.
* Users have reported the problem on various operating systems, including Windows, macOS, and Linux.

**Further Action:**

* Monitor future updates from the PiecesOS team regarding performance improvements.
* Consider alternative solutions if resource usage remains a concern.

related_issues.title: Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
related_issues.text:
Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @bschwenk reported two issues:
    * Context problems with a specific .py file when using Gemini 1.5 flash and gpt4o.
    * Line numbers wrapping in the response.
* @mark-at-pieces confirmed the context issue and assigned it to @sam-at-pieces for further investigation.
* @mark-at-pieces also requested @mack-at-pieces to look into the line number wrapping issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* **Context Issue:** The system did not correctly include the user's .py file in the context, leading to irrelevant responses.
* **Line Number Wrapping:** Line numbers in the response were wrapping, making them difficult to read.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Context Issue:** @sam-at-pieces proposed a fix for the context issue.
* **Line Number Wrapping:** @mark-at-pieces assigned the line number wrapping issue to @mack-at-pieces for further investigation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* **Context Issue:** The fix for the context issue is included in the upcoming release of 11.0.4.
* **Line Number Wrapping:** The status of the line number wrapping issue is not mentioned in the conversation.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation took place on January 13th, 14th, and 15th, 2025.
* The user expressed appreciation for the support team's responsiveness and assistance.

common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Unresponsive or Erroneous
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Copilot being unresponsive, returning errors, or generating irrelevant responses. Issues are often related to specific file types or language models used. Solutions include updating Pieces, switching language models (e.g., to GPT4o), ensuring OpenAI API key validity, and signing into Pieces.

related_issues.title: Copilot is not giving any feedback
related_issues.text:
Copilot is not giving any feedback
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 3.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The copilot is not generating anything, it just keeps on loading.
## GitHub Issue Summary: Claude 3.5 Copilot Response Issues

**Key Points Raised:**

* Gittydia reported experiencing issues with Copilot responses from Claude 3.5, where they received generic "I'm sorry" messages instead of the expected response.

**Problems Identified:**

* Copilot was generating incorrect or unhelpful responses due to a processing error.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces Support identified the issue and reported a potential fix in the upcoming PiecesOS release 11.0.4, scheduled for Thursday.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Users were advised to wait for the release and report back if the issue persists.

**Additional Information:**

* Additional resources for Pieces support were provided in the initial comment for user reference.

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users are experiencing issues with the Pieces service.
* The issues seem to be related to the OpenAI API key and the Claude and Gemini language models.

**Problems Identified:**

* OpenAI API keys may become invalid over time.
* Claude and Gemini language models have been experiencing issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Remove the OpenAI API key.
* Switch to the GPT4o language model.
* Ensure Pieces is updated to version 11.0.3.
* Sign in to Pieces to increase rate limit.
* Switch to an OpenAI model if issues persist.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Removing the OpenAI API key has resolved the issue for some users.
* The root cause of the issues with Claude and Gemini is still being investigated.
* Users are advised to keep their OpenAI API key out of the product for now.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was originally reported on December 28, 2024.
* The latest update was on January 14, 2025.
* The issue is still open and being investigated.

related_issues.title: Copilot is not giving any feedback
related_issues.text:
Copilot is not giving any feedback
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 3.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The copilot is not generating anything, it just keeps on loading.
## GitHub Issue Summary: Claude 3.5 Copilot Response Issues

**Key Points Raised:**

* Gittydia reported experiencing issues with Copilot responses from Claude 3.5, where they received generic "I'm sorry" messages instead of the expected response.

**Problems Identified:**

* Copilot was generating incorrect or unhelpful responses due to a processing error.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces Support identified the issue and reported a potential fix in the upcoming PiecesOS release 11.0.4, scheduled for Thursday.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Users were advised to wait for the release and report back if the issue persists.

**Additional Information:**

* Additional resources for Pieces support were provided in the initial comment for user reference.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of connectivity issues:** Focus on addressing the root causes of connection errors across different Pieces platforms (web, desktop, VS Code) and within Docker containers. This will likely involve investigating API key handling, remote connection protocols, and potential service stability improvements.

**Investigate and address PiecesOS performance issues:** Look into reports of high RAM/CPU usage, potentially caused by internet connectivity problems or inefficient background processes. Optimize PiecesOS for better resource management and investigate potential memory leaks.

**Improve Pieces Copilot and Neural Code Search reliability:** Address issues with Copilot unresponsiveness, errors, and irrelevant responses, particularly with specific file types or language models. Enhance Neural Code Search to ensure consistent and accurate results. This might involve reviewing language model integrations, API interactions, and software logic.

**Proactively communicate known issues and workarounds:** Keep users informed about ongoing problems, such as those related to specific language models (Claude, Gemini) or OpenAI API keys. Provide clear workarounds, such as switching to alternative language models or removing API keys, to minimize user disruption.

**Enhance support documentation and resources:** Expand documentation to include detailed troubleshooting steps for common issues like connectivity problems, API key management, and language model selection. Create or update help articles and tutorials addressing these specific areas.

**Gather more detailed user feedback:** Encourage users to provide comprehensive bug reports, including steps to reproduce the issue, relevant screenshots, and system information. This will help in identifying patterns and root causes more effectively.

**Consider implementing a status page:** Create a public status page to communicate service uptime and any ongoing outages or maintenance activities. This will keep users informed and manage expectations during service disruptions.

**Review and optimize large file handling:** Investigate how Pieces handles large files, as this appears to be a potential contributor to performance issues. Explore optimizations or limitations to improve user experience with larger codebases or datasets.

**Analyze and address trends in user-reported issues:** Regularly analyze support tickets to identify recurring problems and prioritize development efforts accordingly. This data-driven approach will help allocate resources effectively and address the most impactful issues first.
